intro: Lipochaeta deltoidea, commonly known as the deltoid lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Lipochaeta deltoidea is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
